Description.val: Joint Primary Aircraft Training System  (JPATS) is a joint USAF/USN Acquisition Category 1C program.  JPATS includes the T-6 Texan II (a single turboprop engine, stepped tandem seat, commercially derived aircraft), ground based training system (aircrew training devices, development courses, conversion courses, and operational support), and contractor logistics support.   The Training Integration Management System is a major information management system used to manage all student administrative and training requirements.  USAF procurement of 453 T-6A Texan II aircraft was initiated in FY95 and ended in FY08.  The USN originally had a programmed procurement of 315 aircraft with the first procurement in FY00.  Currently, total aircraft authorized is 295; opportunities to buy back aircraft are limited and would require production line extension into FY15.

Justification.val:
JPATS is a joint USN/USAF Acquisition Program designed to replace the aging primary aircraft (T-34/T-37) fleet.  USAF is program executor.  Principal JPATS mission is primary training for entry-level Navy/Air Force student pilots, associated instructor pilots, and primary/intermediate training for USN Naval Flight Officers.

Basis for FY 2014 Budget Request:
The FY 2014 budget request fully funds 29 aircraft in FY14.

JPATS non recurring cost element growth above the OSD/OMB inflation in FY14 is due to program cessation, and an increase in labor due to workforce variations and reductions. This cessation cost is a one-time cost due to FY14 being the last year of production funding. Once the cessation cost is factored out of the non recurring cost then the cost element is within the OSD/OMB inflation rate.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Lot 16 (FY 09) awarded in Feb 2009.   In FY09 PLT was longer.
Lot 17 (FY10) awarded via UCA in Feb 2011. Aircraft delivery schedule remains unchanged due to HBC funding long lead parts at risk.

Lots 19 and 20 will be negotiated concurrently but awarded and priced separately. Planned award date changed due to stalled forward pricing labor rate negotiations and lack of substantiating documentation from contractor for DCAA audit.

ProcQuantity.@footnote: Army: Procure two (2) aircraft as part of Lot 19  buy and delivery is NOV2014.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Contractor made a decision to slow production of LOT 18 which is within contract terms. This causes a rippling effect on deliveries for succeeding lots (LOT 19/20).

ProcQuantity.@footnote: Army: Procure two (2) aircraft as part of Lot 20  buy and delivery is JAN2015.
